title: US House panel probes FCC decision to deny Starlink nearly $900 million
description: The U.S. House committee is investigating the FCC's decision to deny SpaceX's Starlink $885.5 million in rural broadband subsidies, citing Starlink's failure to meet program requirements. Elon Musk criticized the decision, but FCC Chair Jessica Rosenworcel defended it, highlighting competition and performance issues with Starlink.
content: A U.S. House committee said on Monday it is investigating the Federal Communications Commission's decision to deny SpaceX satellite internet unit Starlink $885.5 million in rural broadband subsidies.
cleaned_content: a u s house committee said on monday it is investigating the federal communications commissions decision to deny spacex satellite internet unit starlink <EIGHT_HUNDRED> million in rural broadband subsidies
